## World Series: Baseball's Big Championship

The World Series is the biggest event in American and Canadian baseball. It's a best-of-seven game playoff between the best teams from the American League and National League. The winning team gets the Commissioner's Trophy.

Originally, the teams with the best records in each league made it to the World Series. Now, there are more playoff rounds, including division series and wild card games. The team with the better regular-season record gets to play at home first. People often call the World Series the "Fall Classic" because it happens in autumn.
